headline: Harden Your Systems: Today's Focus Areas

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Disable directory listing
digest_items.why: Directory listing exposes file structure and sensitive files
digest_items.fix: Set 'Options -Indexes' in Apache or 'autoindex off' in nginx

digest_items.title: Verify container image security
digest_items.why: Vulnerable base images introduce security risks to containerized apps
digest_items.fix: Scan images with Trivy or Clair and use minimal base images

digest_items.title: Implement security monitoring
digest_items.why: Real-time monitoring detects attacks and anomalies early
digest_items.fix: Use SIEM tools and set up alerts for suspicious activities

digest_items.title: Review firewall rules
digest_items.why: Overly permissive firewall rules expose unnecessary services
digest_items.fix: Apply principle of least privilege and close unused ports

digest_items.title: Implement security incident response plan
digest_items.why: Prepared response reduces damage and recovery time from breaches
digest_items.fix: Document procedures, assign roles, and conduct regular drills

digest_items.title: Use secure random number generation
digest_items.fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or secrets module, not Math.random()

digest_items.title: Implement rate limiting on APIs
digest_items.why: Rate limits prevent brute force attacks and API abuse
digest_items.fix: Use middleware like express-rate-limit or nginx limit_req module
